channel.title: Mopar IRC
channel.description:
Well, I'm having a problem, for the past month or so I haven't been able to connect to the Mopar IRC network. I thought that it was just down but I knew it wouldn't be down for that long, and it turns out everyone can connect except for me.
I can connect to any other IRC network perfectly fine. I have tried it on both my Linux and Windows machines with the firewall off. Yes, I am trying to connect to the correct server and port, I have looked over that information countless times. (The mopar webIRC client won't even work.) The error message I receive is "Connection timed out." I also can't ping Moparisthebest.com but I can load the page fine. (Obviously or I wouldn't be able to post this.) I can't ping irc.moparisthebest.com either. I have use 3 different IRC client's, all with the same result.
Anything else I should try?

item.title: Mopar IRC
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“mcbeans, post:6, topic:409065”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=510348.msg3703926#msg3703926 date=1312920763]

is your router or proxy intervening? most likely you have some sort of port block that disallows the ports moparscape irc and website uses.

Well I can connect to other IRC networks on the same port just fine, so I don’t think so.
[/quote]
well still check your router for anything that may block it, also check your hosts file and make sure your anti-virus doesn’t have a dns block.[/quote]I already tested that with him a while ago, his computer IS pointing to the right IP address.

Read full topic

item.description:
@mcbeans wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:5, topic:409065”][quote author=mcbeans link=topic=510348.msg3703825#msg3703825 date=1312915684]
is your router or proxy intervening? most likely you have some sort of port block that disallows the ports moparscape irc and website uses.
[/quote]

Well I can connect to other IRC networks on the same port just fine, so I don’t think so.[/quote]
well still check your router for anything that may block it, also check your hosts file and make sure your anti-virus doesn’t have a dns block.

Read full topic
